topic.title: HP Helion 1.3 Development Platform: What's New

body.p: These features and functionality are new in the HP Helion Development Platform 1.3

dlentry.dd: Deploy applications as Docker containers provides an alternative to the usual method of application deployment. Administrators control user permissions and which registries and images are allowed. Local ALS caching registry servers share Docker image layers to improve deployment efficiency.

After installing Helion Development Platform 1.3, you may upgrade existing ALS clusters to use the new images. You do not have to re-create them. Images created in version 1.2 will continue to function, but will not support new features available in version 1.3
The buildpacks have all been updated, including Ruby (2.1.5) and Docker (1.5).
This release includes a merge from Cloud Foundry v205.
More fine-grained Admin permission controls are now available.

Windows server stack has been updated to improve customer experience
.NET buildpack streamlined with a Java workflow
.NET buildpack packaged as an Admin buildpack providing updatability
Support for Microsoft SQL Server tunneling
General performance improvements
Improved deployment workflow, application file browsing, service instance creation, and more.
